dialogue.text: Hi.   You know...

dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.text: What... well, do you have a driver's license?

dialogue.text: Did you even look at the form?  I've already answered these question.

dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.text: If it makes you stop acting like a child.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I have been to California my whole--

dialogue.text: Maybe you never been to the D.M.V. before, maybe you should get back in line.  You know what?  sit in line again and if you get my number ask for different one.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.text: I'm perfectly calm.

dialogue.text: They don't pay me enough to deal people like you.

dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.text: So you're not going to send me a thank you card, is that a problem? Is your are not going...

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, dear. Oh, boo-foo-woo, foo-foo.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, no honey. And you're going to miss the Christmas card too. It's a shame. It's going to be a good, nice picture.

dialogue.text: Sit back down.

dialogue.text: We were very much younger then.

dialogue.text: And very much sillier.

dialogue.text: However I believe the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh.  You knew there was nothing in that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.

dialogue.text: Presents?  It was only a trivial, little brooch.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was bristling with diamonds.  In the worst possible taste, too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It was not.  I still have it, and I wear it often.  It is very pretty.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I did not.  You worked that whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, you let him kiss you, huh?  You said you did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, what of it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't hurt me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What about me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: If you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's a nice point of view, I must say.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh dear.  I'm bored with this conversation.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So am I.  I'm bored stiff. [GARBAGE]  Do you want some brandy?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.  Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'll have a little, I think.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't know why you'd want any, you've already had three glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow, they are very small ones.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I just think it's silly to go on and on and on about such a thing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can hardly call three glasses of liquor a whole evening long, going on and on and on.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's become a habit with you.

dialogue.text: Oh.  Don't be so grand.  Just because you don't happen to want one at the moment.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't be stupid.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Really, Amanda.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: you going out somewhere, dear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.  I am just making myself fascinating for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That reply has broken my heart.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh.  It's a woman's duty to allure the man.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well as a matter of fact, yes, that's perfectly true.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No it isn't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh really.  It's a pity you didn't have any brandy, it would have made you a little less disagreeable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's funny it hasn't worked such wonders for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Snap, snap, snap.  You know you are like a little adder.

dialogue.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nonsense.  They have a bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap. They snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They sting. I don't care.  Do you understand?  I don't care if they bark and they roll about like hoops.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes I did, quite a lot.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I suppose you let him kiss you a good deal more than, too. Yes.  I suppose you guys had a riotous time, huh?  All out, no restraint at all.  Well, you never really had much anyhow.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Mind your own business.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're quite insufferable, I expect it's because you are drunk.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I think I am not in the least bit drunk.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You've always had a weak head.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I think I mentioned once before that I've had three minute liquor glasses the whole evening long.  A child of two cannot get drunk on that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: On the contrary, a child of two can get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's very interesting Amanda. How about a child of four?  Or a child of six?  Or a child of nine? We can get a good little conversation going on about this, you know, intemperate tots.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh shut up.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not very funny, darling.  Why don't you have some more brandy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER] That's a very good idea.  I think I will.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look, you better turn that off. I don't want to wake up the people upstairs.

dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.text: There are no people upstairs; it's a photographer's studio.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well then you'll wake up the people downstairs.

dialogue.text: They are away in Tunis.

dialogue.text: This is no time of year for Tunis.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Turn it on again, please.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I will do no such thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Fine if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Will you turn that off, it's driving me mad.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You are far too temperamental, try to control yourself.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I won't.  Let go, let go of me. Listen, listen?  I'm sick and tired of listening to you, you sadistic bully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Amanda, listen, listen.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh.  That's very amusing indeed.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh shut up.  Let go.  I hate you, I hate you.  Do you hear?  You are a conceited and overbearing and utterly impossible.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You are a vile, ill-tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I never want to see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is the end.  Do you hear me?  Finally and forever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not going like this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh.  Yes I am.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes I am.   Stop it. Stop it.  Let go of me. Oh.  You're a cruel fiend.  I loathe and I hate you. Marry you again?  Never, never, never. I hope you die in torment, you brute beast cad.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shut up. Shut up. God, I wouldn't marry you again if you came crawling back to me on a bended knee.  You are a vile, ill-tempered, mean little wench and I never want to see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.text: Why did he invite her here?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, maybe he wanted see her.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's been three and a half years.  Why all of a sudden?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well uh, He grew up next door to the girl, why wouldn't he want to see her?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Don't look at me like that.  He didn't tell me anything he told you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: He's not going to marry her.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How do you know he's even thinking about it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: it's got that about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh so what?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What is going on here, Joe?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay, now listen, kids...

dialogue.text: The girl is not Larry's.  If the girl is Larry's girl she's not his she know she's not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Listen. Line. You can't read her mind.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Then why is she still single?  New York is full of men probably a hundred people told her she is crazy but she is waited.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And how do you know why she's waited.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Because she knows what I know that's why.  She's faithful as a rock. in my darkest moments I think of her waiting and I know that I'm right.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay, look it's a beautiful day.  Why are we arguing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Nobody in this house dares take away her faith Joe.  Her- strangers might but not her father, not her brother.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What do you want me to do?  What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want you to---act like he is coming back.  Don't think I haven't noticed you, both of you since Chris invited her here.  I won't stand for any nonsense.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Kate...

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Honey, you knew there was nothing in that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Presents?  Just a trivial little broach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, I remember it well.  Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it wasn't.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, I didn't.  You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You must admit, he was in love with you, wasn't he?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, what of it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It didn't hurt him at all and I enjoyed it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, what about me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, that's a nice point of view I must say.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm bored with this conversation.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Me, too.  Bored stiff.  You want some brandy?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I think I'll have some.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't see why you want any.  You've already had two glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow they were very small ones.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, it's become a habit with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You needn't be so grand, just because you don't happen to want any yourself at the moment.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't be so stupid.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Really, Amanda.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Going out somewhere dear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, just making myself fascinating for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That reply has broken my heart.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: A woman's job is to allure the man.  Watch me a minute, will you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it isn't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, be quiet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, it's a pity you didn't have any more brandy.  It might have made you a little less disagreeable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nonsense.  They have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't care, do you understand?  I don't care.  I don't care if they bark or roll about like hoops.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I did.  Quite a lot.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hmm, I imagine you let him kiss you a good deal more then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Mind your own business.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, must have had a riotous time. No restraint at all.  Very enjoyable and never had much anyhow.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're quite insufferable

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I expect it's because you're drunk.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm not in the least drunk.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You've always had a weak head.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, I have had three minute liquor glasses of brandy the whole evening long.  A child of two couldn't get drunk on that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: On the contrary, a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of brandy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, very interesting.  How about a child of four?  A child of six?  Or a child of nine?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We could get a good debate going about this, don't you think?  Intemperate tots.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not very funny, dear.  You'd better have some more brandy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right.  I will.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You better turn that off, I think.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Because it's late and it'll annoy the people upstairs.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: There aren't any people upstairs.  It's a photographer's studio.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There are people downstairs I suppose?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They're away in Tunis.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is no time of the year for Tunis.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Turn it on again, please.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'll do no such thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Very well, if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.  It's driving me mad.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You are far too temperamental.  Try to control yourself.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Stop it.  Go away.  I hate you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Amanda, listen. listen

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Listen?  Listen, indeed.  I am sick and tired of listening to you, damn sadistic bully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Very amusing, indeed.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I hate you.  Stop it.  Stop it.  I hate you, do you hear?  You're conceited and overbearing and utterly impossible.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're a vile, tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I hope to never see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is the end.  Finally and forever.  Do you hear me?  The end.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not going like this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh Yes, I am.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I am.  Let go of me.  You're a cruel fiend and I hate and loathe you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shut up. Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wouldn't-- I wouldn't marry--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wouldn't marry you if you came in crawling on your knees

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Thank God I realized what you are-- I'd never marry you again ever in my life. You're a cruel fiend and I hate you. You're a beast. You're a beast--I hate you. Stop it.  Stop it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're a evil vampire and I hope to God I never see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, so what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What I was saying.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It certainly is not.  It's slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's PR.  Somebody sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is gonna take place on the beach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I'm not the only one.  Look at all these people.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Sure, everybody's told the same story.  It keeps us all excited.  It keeps us coming back for more.  It keeps us thinking that life is gonna start any second now if we could just find the right spot and get in on the action.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are we talking about the same thing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I'm sorry, but it's still just fish to me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Carla, can I ask you something?  Don't take this wrong, but are you having your period?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: God damn it, Augie, don't ask me that.  I hate it when you ask me that.  You always ask me that.  It's insulting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, what's bugging you?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We just have different ideas of what this evening is supposed to look like.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's nothing to it.  We come here, the grunion arrive, they do their little fish business, we go ooh, ah, look at the fish.  They go home. We go home.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heaven sake, we're not going to see the grunions.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We never do, do we?  I mean, have we ever?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We've missed them twice.  That's not ever.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Twice is every time we've tried. That's ever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, we'll see them this year.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, we won't.  It's pointless.  It's like waiting up to see Santa Claus.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, I feel like my whole life is gonna be spent standing on the beach with my eyes wide open and my hands clasped expectantly waiting for the fish to show up.  And the fish won't show up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I thought you wanted to see it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You don't understand anything I'm saying.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, of course not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I did want to see it.  I always do.  I keep thinking that this is gonna be the time and it never is.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's just fish.  Nothing to get traumatized about.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heaven sake, this isn't about fish.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right.  Look, I've been trying to work this backwards, but I cannot seem to figure out the exact moment that we took a turn for the worst.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, you were-  you were fine during the phone call from Marge.  Dinner was okay.  Doing the dishes was no problem.  Let's see.  I took a shower.  You watched the news.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You said, "Hey the grunion are running tonight."  I said, "Great, let's go.  I feel lucky."

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay, so I'm putting on my jacket, putting out the animals, getting the car out of the garage--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you remember the first time we came to see it?  It was about four years ago, right after we got married.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I thought I was pregnant, you had a bottle of champagne, but no glasses.  You asked me to dance, so we kicked off our shoes and you popped the cork.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And while we were dancing, you said the softest, most intimate things to me right into my ear so that I could feel them as much as hear them.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And I remember thinking, this is it.  You know, at last--at last I am as happy as I am supposed to be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Wait a minute.  I've got it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just dancing barefoot in the sand, drinking champagne out of the bottle.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was in the car, right?  Driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker, you said, "let's get some champagne," and I said, "time's a wasting" or something like that, right?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, of course, I see it now.  You want this to be like that other time, right?  That's it, right?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'd rather not remember some things.  I would rather not hope for some things.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay, yeah, sure, I see it now.  Listen, you wanna dance?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want me to go get some champagne?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Take off our shoes?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No. No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, what?  You want me to breathe in your ear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You wanna get married again?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What?  What?  You want a divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A vacation?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A new carpet?  A poodle?  Ice cream?  Back rub?  A suicide pact?  What?  What?  Carla, what the hell do you want?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want something to turn out the way that it's supposed to.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, welcome to the human race.  Do you think this is what I had in mind when I proposed?  That four years down the road, we'd be at the beach yelling at each other over fish?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No.  You think I knew that there'd be times when you'd look at me like a used Kleenex?  Or that I'd look at you and think, holy hell, when's the next flight to Alaska?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, Carla, I'm just like you.  I thought it was gonna be all peaches and roses and sand in our toes and wind in our hair and the fish will always come and the bills will pay themselves and we'll have three fat rosy kids and ha, ha, baby, the joke's on us

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: 'cause you know what you get, Carla?  You know what you get?  This.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This.  What?  What is this?  This isn't even anything.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Uh, right this is standing on the beach.  This is waiting.  This is fighting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well.  This isn't anything like I thought anything would be like.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know, me neither.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, this is just this.  It includes a lot and everything, but it isn't something else.  Do you have any idea what I'm trying to say?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm doing the best I can.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know that, Augie.  Really, I do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know that you meant this to be special and nice and the sand and the moon and all, but I just couldn't help thinking about being somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Maybe if you were with somebody else too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I didn't say that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know.  But still.  I know I don't make you happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, for heaven sake, whatever I'm doing, I'd rather be doing it with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, don't be ridiculous.  I mean, don't you know that?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're the one who probably wishes you were with someone else.  Someone who--you'd rather enjoy yourself and didn't take everything so hard.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, now that you mention it.  No, I don't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.  Fine so.  We're in the wrong spot, but we're with the right person.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know.  It seemed like a pretty good spot to me.  I mean, look at the view you have of the moon from here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, I noticed that.  Looks pretty, doesn't it?  Big ol' white moon.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, look what we have here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, you brought refreshments.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not champagne.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, then we don't need glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You still cold?  Do you wanna go home?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.  I think you might be right.  Maybe this is the spot after all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shh.  If we're very quiet the fish might come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What I was saying.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Certainly it's not. Slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's PR. Someone sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is going to take place on the beach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I'm not the only one look at all these people.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yea, sure everyone was sold the same story. I mean it keeps us all excited, keeps us coming back for more, keeps us thinking that life is going to start any second now if we can just get in on the action and find the right spot.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are we talking about the same thing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry but it's still just fish to me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Carla, can I ask you something? Don't take this wrong but are you having your period?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Goddamn it Augie don't ask me that. I hate it when you ask me that. You always ask me that. It's insulting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, what's bugging you?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We just have different ideas of what this evening is supposed to look like.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There is nothing to it, we come here, the Grunion arrive, then do their little fish business, we go oh ah look, they go home, we go home.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heavens sake we are not going to see the Grunions.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We've missed them twice; that's not ever.

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: "the Grunion are running tonight," I said "great, let's go, I feel lucky,"

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want something to turn out the way that it supposed to.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know. But still, I know I don't make you happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heavens sake, whatever I'm doing I'd rather be doing it with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't be ridiculous. I mean don't you know that?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're the one who probably wishes he was with someone else, someone who knew how to enjoy herself and didn't take everything so hard.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it. No, I don't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.  Fine, so we're in the wrong spot but we're with the right person.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know it seemed like a pretty good spot to me. Look at the moon - view the moon view I got from here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I noticed that. It looks pretty on the water doesn't it? Big old white moon.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What have we got here?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, you brought refreshments.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not champagne.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I guess we don't need glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You still cold? Do you want my jacket? Do you want to go home?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No. No. I think you might be right. I think this may be the spot after all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Augie, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shh, if we're very quiet the fish might come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hmm.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Kathy died last night.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh my God. Oh my God, I'm so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: yeah, I mean, you know, it was a -

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I guess we saw it coming and she lasted a lot - a lot longer than, uh, they expected but you know, I mean when it actually happens it's just a lot harder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It doesn't make any easier, yes.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean at least she was home, she wasn't in the hospital anymore,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, man. I'm so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She was with- yeah  She was with Gary, and he said that she was just sitting there and went to sleep, closed her eyes, and that was it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's going to be so rough, I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes. I mean, it's not as rough on me as it is on him but

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: God, it's you know, we've spent so much time with them it's just really surreal, really weird that we're not going to be able to see her anymore and go

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: out to- out to dinner you know and do the troops to California, I mean.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Totally.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's just that- I don't know, it's sort it's sort- of a weird thing you know

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: not being able to see anyone again, who knows where they really went, you know. I mean, I guess we can just hope that wherever they are now if it's anywhere that it's better I mean.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes. Well, at least you have a lot of good memories.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She was [garbage]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: She really cared about you, you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, I mean she cared about all of us. She was great

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: so loving everybody you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And she was

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Gosh, I just hate I just hate to see her go.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We were all going take a trip to Europe you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Even if you still do she'll- she'll be there.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes.  [BREATHING] God.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Are you going to be okay?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just -- I just don't get it, like there is just nothing you can do about it you know, it's like just out of your control and it

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: just makes it that much harder to deal 'cause as much as you want to, you know, make her better, see her not in any pain, it's like, just I don't know, just has a mind of its own.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Then she's gone.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's going to be okay, I promise.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, you know I appreciate you coming over and talking to me, I mean it definitely helps

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Sure

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: to talk to somebody but

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: you shouldn't be alone

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's just going to take a while, I think.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You knew there was nothing in that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Presents, just a trivial little broach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, I remember it well, bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No it wasn't. It was very pretty I still have it and I wear it often.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No I didn't, you worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You must admit he was in love with you, wasn't he?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You let him kiss you; you said you did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It gave him a lot of pleasure, it didn't hurt me any.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What about me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if you hadn't been so nosey and suspicious you never wouldn't have known anything about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's a nice point of view I must say.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm bored of this conversation.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, me too, bored stiff. You want some Brandy?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No thanks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I have a little I think.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't see why you want any you've already had two glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No particular reason. Anyhow, they are very small ones.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, it's become a habit with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You needn't be so grand just because don't happen want any yourself right now.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't be so stupid.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Really, Amanda.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No I'm just making myself fascinating for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Going out somewhere, dear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's a woman's job to allure the man

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That reply has broken my heart.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: watch me a minute, will you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, no it isn't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Be quiet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's a pity you didn't have any more Brandy it might have made you a little less disagreeable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It doesn't seem to work such wonders with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Adders don't snap they sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh nonsense they have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't care. Do you understand? I don't care. I don't care if they bark or roll about like hoops.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Tell me, did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I did quite a lot.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I imagine you let him kiss you good deal more then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Mind your own business.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What riotous time you must have had.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No restraint at all, very enjoyable, never had much anyhow.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're quite insufferable. I expect it's because you're drunk.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I am not in the least drunk.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I imagine, as I may have already mentioned, I've had three minute liquor glasses of Brandy the whole evening long a child of two couldn't get drunk on that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: On the contrary a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of Brandy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh very interesting. How about a child of four, a child of six or a child of nine?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh be quiet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We can get a good little debate going about that, don't you think? Intemperate tots.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not very funny my dear, you better have some more Brandy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All right. I will.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Better turn that off I think.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Because it's late and it'll annoy the people upstairs.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: There aren't any people upstairs it's a photographer's studio.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There are people downstairs I suppose?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They're away in Tunis.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is no time of the year for Tunis.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Turn it on again, please.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'll do no such thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Very well, if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off it's driving me mad.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You are far too temperamental. Try to control yourself.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Stop it. Stop it. I hate you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Amanda, listen. Listen.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Listen indeed. I'm sick and tired of listening to you, damn sadistic bully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Very amusing indeed.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Stop it. Stop it. I hate you, do you hear? You're overbearing and conceited and utterly impossible.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're a vile tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I hope I never see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is the end, do you hear? The end finally and forever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not going like this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh yes I am.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, I am. Let go of me you're cruel fiend and I hate and loathe you. Thank God I realized who you really are before I would ever, ever marry you again. I would never marry you again. I'd rather die in torment.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wouldn't marry you again if you came to me on your bended knees. You're a evil minded little vampire. I hope to God I never see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're a beast. I hate you. Stop it. Stop it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hello?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh God I finally got...you know how long I've been waiting on line?  You put on hold for like five hours.  Geez.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm sorry ma'am.  What's the nature of your problem?  But first can I get you to tell me your first and last name?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I've already been through this five times with these people.  I've been calling every single day.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know I just need to verify every time.  I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Olivia Brown.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Alright Ms. Brown what's the nature of your problem?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well my phone isn't working and it hasn't been working for the last five days.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh.  I'm sorry. Um- Did you drop it in water?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah you better be sorry.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No I did not drop my phone in water.  I'm not five years old and just dropped my phone anywhere I see it.  Okay this is my business.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay?  And it [GARBAGE]. My business is failing because my phone isn't working and I don't have a land line and I really can't handle this right now.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Um- well it's probably easy.  Can you any more symptoms either you're not receiving calls----ok, you're not receiving calls, not getting calls.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: the symptoms- This [GARBAGE] a doctor's office. I'm not receiving calls...I can't receive- no, it's, it cuts me off--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Is the phone turned on?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes the phone turns on.  No I mean I'm using it not turning on the phone.  Of course it turns on.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, um- okay.  Your sim card is in- didn't fall out-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No- I don't have a sim card because it's Verizon and you guys don't use sim cards.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Alright.  Um- Well that could be the problem. cause--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: you might have an older phone where we would use sim cards but probably not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay no.  Sir, this is the deal.  My phone isn't working and I don't care what the problem is but it needs to work.  That's why I'm paying you guys to fix it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay.  How about this we'll send you a brand new camera phone with palm pilot-- and-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't know even how to use that stuff it's too complicated.  I just want my flip phone to work----that's all I need

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So we'll send it- And we'll give you, how about a free year's service?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I am on the road all the time.  Do you understand how important?  I'm a woman, a single mother by herself working...what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Tell them my name.  My name is Brent Backersen.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Brent Backersen, I am writing this down, Brent Backersen.  Alright.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay.  Tell them my - my ID number is two one three five.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Tell them that.  You can go in, get a brand new phone, they'll hook you up with service even give you a free three months--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I, I, I don't want a contract. Okay. I don't want any contracts.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It will be free.  No contract okay?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Really?  No contract?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Go in there, yeah, go in there.  Tell them Brent Backersen sent you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want the best freaking camera phone there is though.  I want the really good kind--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: the top of the line camera phone, game boy, anything you want. For free. And palm pilot.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And palm pilot.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And charger and accessories and I want a cover that's pink.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They might only have orange.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: no

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay.  They can figure out pink for you.  So go in there and just tell them that and they'll hook you up with other goodies, stuff like that free service, no contract, no nothing.  Just for being a good customer

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: and battling through with us.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Alright. Well-  I guess - I guess that's okay but,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: you better promise me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes.  You just tell them Brent Backersen sent you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Alright?  Great.  Have a nice evening.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Alright Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're the only one I know that still loves his parents.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah. I know. It went out of style, didn't it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it's all right. There's nothing wrong in that, you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's really lovely here. The air is sweet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're not sorry you came?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No. I'm not sorry. It's-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't stay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, for one thing, your mother so much has told me to go. [LAUGHTER].

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: you've been acting kind of, well, you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, you've been embarrassed ever since I came.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, I guess I have been. But it's going from me now.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh look, um, well, the thing is, I was planning on, planning on sort of sneaking up on you over a week or so, and they-they take it for granted we're all set.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How did you know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, they would. Especially your mom.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, uh- would you want to?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I, I guess that's why I asked you to come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I mean,

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, Annie.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: from her opinion, why else would I come here?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Annie, I love you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I love you a great deal.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I-I love you. I have no imagination. That's all I know how to tell it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I guess that's why I came.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm embarrassing you. I didn't want to tell you it here. I wanted to go somewhere that would be brand-new to each other. It feels wrong here, don't you? This yard and this chair.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't want to win you from anybody. I want you to be ready for me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I've been ready for a long, long time.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Then he's gone forever. You're sure?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I was almost married two years ago.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: 'Cause you started to write me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You felt something that far back?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Every day since.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why didn't you let me know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know, you didn't write until then and then when you did, what'd you say?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You always can be so ambiguous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Give me a kiss, Annie.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Give me-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER]. God, I kissed Annie. I kissed Annie. How long, how long I've been waiting to kiss you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't know if I ever can forgive you for that. Why'd you wait so long? I sat in my room wondering if I was crazy for thinking about you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We're going to live now. I'm going to make you so happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not like that, you're not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I kissed you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Like Larry's brother. Do it like you, Chris.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Let's drive somewhere. I want to be alone with you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No. What is it? Is it your mother?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, no, no, no. Nothing like that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well then tell me what's wrong. I mean, even in your letters there's something ashamed.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah. I guess there is. I guess I was, but uh- it's going from me now.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You should tell me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know where to start.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But, Chris, it wouldn't work like this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know when I went overseas. I said I was in command of a company.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I lost them.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: How many?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just about all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Geez.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It takes a little while to toss that off. Because they weren't just men.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: For instance, one time, it had to have been raining several days. There was this one kid, he came up to me and he gave me his last pair of dry socks. Put them in my pocket.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, that's-that's only a little thing, but that's the kind of guys I had. They didn't just die. They killed themselves for each other. And I mean that exactly. A little more selfish and they'd still be here today.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I, and I thought something watching them go down.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Everything was being destroyed, see, but there was one new thing that was being created. A kind of responsibility, man for man. You understand me?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And to show that-to bring that onto the earth like some sort of monument standing right behind us where everyone could feel it and it would make a difference to him.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I came back here and it was incredible. There was no meaning in that here. The whole thing to them was a bus accident.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I went to work with dad and that rat race again. And I felt what you said-ashamed somehow. Because nobody was changed at all. It seemed to make a sucker out of a lot of guys.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I felt wrong to be alive. To drive the car, to see the new checkbook, to see the new refrigerator. I mean, you can take those things out of the war. But you got to know that when you drive that car that that came out of the love a man can have for another man. And you got to be a little bit better because of that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Otherwise, what you have here is loot; and there's blood on it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I didn't want to take any of it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I guess that included you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And you still feel that way?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I want you now, Annie.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Because you can't feel that way, never again, Chris. You hear me? Never. I mean, the money and me too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, there's nothing wrong in that money, and your father put good planes up in the air and you should be proud of that. A man should be paid for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Annie,

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Annie, I'm going to make a fortune for you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What am I going to do with a fortune?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You knew there was nothing in that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Presents? It was only a small trivial little broach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I remember it well. Bristling with diamonds. In the worst possible taste.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not at all. It was very pretty. And I wear it all the time. I still have it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, I didn't. You made that up all in your jealous imagination.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You must admit that he was in love with you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just a little perhaps, but it was nothing serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You let him kiss you. You said so.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, what of it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh come on, it gave him a lot of pleasure and it didn't harm me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What about me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey you'd have never known anything about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's a nice point of view, I must say.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, it's true.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are you bored with this conversation?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I definitely, most definitely am.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So am I. Bored stiff. Want some brandy?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'll have a little, I think.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't see why you want it; you've already had two glasses.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No particular reason. Anyhow, they were very small ones.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't see what's the point of going on and on about something like this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, my-you can hardly call three minute liquor glasses in the evening going on and on and on.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's become a habit with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want some yourself at the moment.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't be so stupid.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Really, Amanda.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Going somewhere, dear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No. Just making myself fascinating for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That reply has broken my heart.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's a woman's job to allure the man. Watch me, won't you, a minute?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it isn't.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it's not. I don't care.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's a pity you didn't have more brandy. It might have made you a little less disagreeable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, it didn't seem to do such wonders with you, now did it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: They sting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They snap.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't care. I don't care, do you understand? I don't care if they bark, if they roll over on the floor like hoops.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Uhh,

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm not in the least bit drunk.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You've always had a weak head.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay. As I mentioned before, I said I had three very minute liquor glasses. That's hardly enough to get a child of two drunk.

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, very interesting indeed. How about a child of four or a child of six or a child of nine. We might have a splendid little debate about this intemperate tots.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do shut up. Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Turn it on.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Turn it off.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I will not. Go away. Go away. I hate you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, very amusing, indeed. Amanda, listen-

dialogue.text: Listen, indeed. No, no, no, no. I am sick and tired of listening to you, you sadistic bully.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Stop it, stop it, I hate you, I loath you, you are overbearing and conceited and utterly impossible.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know, you're a vile, ill-tempered, wicked little beast and I hope that I never see you again as long as I live.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is the end. Do you hear? The end. Now and forever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, you're not going out like this. No you're not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, yes I am.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes I am. Let go of me. I hate you and I loath you. God, I can't believe I just finally realized how you are. I am never marry you. Never. Never, never, never. I would rather die in torment.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, shut up. Shut up. Shut up.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER]. You mustn't be serious, my dear one, that's what they want.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if I laugh at everything I'm going to have to laugh at us too.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ooh, certainly you must. We're figures of fun, all right.

dialogue.text: Well, that's serious enough.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.text: Elliott, worms don't pop.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Thank you, dear. The same applies to you. Except that if I ever so much as catch you looking at another woman I'll kill you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Horrible little thing. I hated it.

dialogue.speaker: F

dialogue.text: When?

dialogue.text: I don't know. But after it cracked he ran back into the house and he cried in the kitchen.

dialogue.text: Did you talk to him?

dialogue.text: He cried hard?

dialogue.text: God, what was he doing out there anyway?

dialogue.text: Starting to dream about him again.  He's walking around at night again.

dialogue.text: He's getting just like he did after he died, you know?  What, what, what's the meaning of this?

dialogue.text: I don't know.  But I know one thing mom, we made a terrible mistake with dad.

dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
