dialogue.text: We just have different ideas about what this evening is supposed to look like.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's nothing to it.  We come down here.  The grunions arrive.  They do their little fish business.  We go ooh, ah, look at the fish.  They go home.  We go home.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heaven's sake, we are not going to see the grunions.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We never do, do we?  Have we ever?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We've missed them twice.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's not ever.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Twice is every time we've tried.  That's ever.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We'll see them this year.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, we won't.  It's pointless.  It's like waiting up to see Santa Claus.  I feel as though my entire life is going to be spent standing on the beach with my eyes wide open and my hands clasped expectantly waiting for the fish to show up.  And the fish won't show up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I thought you wanted to see them.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You don't have any idea what I'm saying.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, of course, not.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I did want to see it.  I always do.  I keep thinking this time will be the time, but it never is.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's just fish; nothing to get traumatized over.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heaven's sake, this is not about fish.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've been trying to work this backwards, but I can't seem to pinpoint the moment when we took a turn for the worse.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You were fine during the phone call from Marge.  Dinner was okay.  Doing the dishes was no problem.  Let's see, I took a shower.  Uh, you watched the news.  You said the grunions are running tonight.  I said great, let's go.  I feel lucky tonight.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Uh,okay.  So I'm putting on my jacket; putting out the animals;

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you remember the first time we came to see it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: uh, taking the car out of the gara- out of the garage.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Uh.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It was about four years ago, right after we got married.  We thought I was pregnant and we had a bottle of champagne but no glasses.  You asked me to dance.  So we took off our shoes and you popped the cork.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And while we were dancing, you said the softest, most intimate things to me, right into my ear so that I could feel them as much as hear them.  And I remember thinking this is it.  At last, at last I'm as happy as I'm supposed to be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, I've got it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Dancing barefoot in the sand; drinking champagne from the bottle.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was in the car, right?  Driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker?  You said let's get some champagne and I said times a wasting or something like that.  Right?  That's it, right?  You want this to be like the other time.  That's it.  Of course.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'd rather not remember some things.  I'd rather not hope for some things.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Sure.  Okay.  Alright.  I've got it.  Listen do you want to dance?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want to get some champagne?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What, you want me to breathe in your ear?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You want to get married again?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What, you want a divorce?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A vacation?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: A new carpet?  A poodle?  An ice cream?  A back rub?  A suicide pact?  What?  What, Carla?  What the hell do you want?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I want something to turn out the way it's supposed to.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well welcome to the human race.  You think this is what I had in mind?  You think that when I proposed, I had this great fantasy going that four years down the line, we'd come to the beach and yell at each other over fish?  No.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I'm just like you.  I thought it was going to be all peaches and roses and wind in our hair and sand in our toes and the fish will always come and the bills will always pay themselves.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And we'll have three fat rosy kids and ha, ha, ha, baby, the joke's on us, 'cause you know what you get, Carla?  You know what you get?  This.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This what?  What is this?  This isn't even anything.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, it is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, right, sure.  This is standing on the beach.   This is waiting.  This is fighting.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But this isn't anything like I thought anything would be like.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know, me neither.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is just this.  I mean, it includes a lot and everything, but it's just not, you know, something else.  Do you have any idea what I'm trying to say?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm doing the best I can.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know you are, Augie.  Really, I do.  I know you meant for this to be special and nice and it's the full moon and the sand and everything.  But I just couldn't help thinking about being somewhere else.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Maybe if you were with somebody else, too, huh?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I didn't say that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, I know.  But still.  I know I don't make you happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: For heaven's sake, whatever I'm doing, I'd rather be doing it with you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well don't be ridiculous.  Don't you know that?  You're the one who probably wishes you were with somebody else; somebody who knew how to enjoy herself and didn't take everything so hard.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Actually, now that you mention it, no.  I don't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay, fine.  So we're in the wrong spot, but we're with the right person.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know.  It seemed like a good spot to me.  I mean, look at the view you've got of the moon from here.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, I noticed that.  Looks pretty on the water, doesn't it?  Big ol' white moon.  I'm sorry, Augie.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Shh.  If we're very quiet, the fish might come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Or not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's only going to be a year.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's the first year of your child's life.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's really -- there's nothing I can do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're just fine with this?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's nothing I --

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're just going to pick up and leave me and our baby and miss a year of our lives?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's -- look, it's only a year.  It'll go by quickly.  Okay.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: When you get back, think of all of the things that you're going to have missed.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know, but I'll be back then.  And - and- and we'll have -- we have the rest of our lives.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't go.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't do that.  I have to go.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you want to -- do you want to leave us behind?  I mean, I don't understand why you have to do this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've made a pledge.  I can't not do this at this point.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You've made a pledge to us, too.  Remember that day, we stood in front of each other and said 'til death do us part.  Put on some rings and it's supposed to mean something.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know that. I know that. I know that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's nothing I can do.  I mean, I have to go.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And this is what I do.  This is -- I mean, this is my life.  And I know that you're part of my life, too, and I mean, it's only -- it's just going to be a year.  I'll be back.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Can't you ask them?  Can't you go back and ask them if you could -- I don't know if you could change  assignments or something and you could stay here?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not- it's not- It's not like that.  It's not like that.  I can't do that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Why not?  You could, at least, try.  They have to understand

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Because it's impossible.  There's -- I just can't.  I can't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You won't even know your child when you come back.  This -- isn't there someone you could talk to?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Explain the situation to them and then you can stay here.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look, honey, it's- it's- it's only going to be a year.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's only going to be a year. I'm not going to miss my son's entire life.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And what happens if, at the end of that year, they ask you to stay longer?  Are you just going to agree?  Are you just going to absentmindedly brainwashedly do whatever it is they tell you to do?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm not going to stay more than a year.  I've  agreed to a year

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Then why do you have to go a year at all?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Because I've already agreed to that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well unagree.  Tell them that you can't leave right now.  I can't do this by myself.  I can't do this without you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, you can.  Yes, you can.  You know you can.  You're a strong person.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is supposed to be a partnership.  We're supposed to do this together. I'm not supposed to be left here to do this by myself while you leave.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It is. It is. It is. It is. I'm going to write you every day.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What am I supposed to do, read your letters?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What else can we do?  I -- we don't have a choice in this.  Do you understand?  You can't come with me and I can't stay here.  That's all there is to it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: There has to be something.  I mean, we can't just live with this.  It's not -- it just won't work this way.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We don't have a choice.  I have to do this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just tell them no.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't do it.  I'd love to.  I mean, I don't - if you understand, I don't want to stay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, I don't want to -- I don't want to leave.  I want to stay here with you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Then, can't you please try something?  If you go and ask them and they say no, then I would understand, but you're not even willing to ask.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Can't you just make an effort?  Can't you just try?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've asked already.  I can't go back.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It can't happen.  I have to go.  I want to stay really bad, but I can't.  There's just no -- I don't have an option.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: When do you leave?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Next week.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: A week.  You're giving me a week to be okay with this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You can't make it out like I'm happy about this.  I mean, I didn't -- I didn't want to put you in this situation.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well it doesn't seem like you're that bothered by it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I am.  I mean, I don't know.  I don't know what else to tell -- you know, I mean, I can tell you.  I don't know what else to do. I mean, I've been forced into this situation.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: If you really cared so much, you'd find a way out.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There's nothing I can do.  I-- I

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Fine, fine.  We have to be together.  If you can't stay here, then I'll go with you.  I don't care where you go.  We'll go, too.  I'm not staying behind.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They won't let you come along.  It's not going to happen.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's a free world.  I can go where I want.  Wherever you are, that's where we're going to go.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? Please don't be difficult about this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Difficult.  You're leaving for a year. We have a newborn child and you're leaving.  I don't think I'm being difficult.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [BREATHING]

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm finding a way to make it work.  And I will go wherever you go.  Whatever I have to do, I will make this work.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look, I--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're not really giving me a lot of options.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Where I'm going is not the safest place on the earth.  Okay.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But I'm supposed to be okay with you going there.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But I've been trained.  You have no training.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm not going to stay here and wait.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You have to.  Do you understand me?  You have to.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't do it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well I guess we're at a stalemate then, aren't we?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hey, how you doing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know- I know there's nothing I can say that will really help, but--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know.  I just -- I don't know.  It's just weird because you have somebody who's, you know,

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: a major part of your life and then they're gone.  And I don't know.  That's not really -- it's never really happened to me before.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.  It's never easy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But, I'm here if there's anything you need.  I mean, you just have to ask.  I know --

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: --it doesn't really do anything.  But--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just -- it's just not fair.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know.  It never is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: How's, um -- how's his parents doing?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, they're, you know, they're upset.  It's like you know, they

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: feel the same way everybody else does.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, what do you want to do?  Do you want to- do you want to talk about it?  Do you-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: [BREATHING] I mean, there's nothing really to talk about.  He's gone and I'll never see him again.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well I know it's not a lot of help or anything, but at least you got to know him.  I mean, at least you had the time with him that you did.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, we can be grateful for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, I don't know.  Sometimes I wish I didn't know him.  So I wouldn't--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You feel that way now because you're upset.  But you don't really think that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It'll get better.  I know it doesn't help, but it will get better and you will remember all of the good things that you guys had; all of the memories that you have with him that were happy and you'll be grateful for those.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is just -- this is a terrible life.  I just don't understand.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Just life, in general?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, it's just not fair.  Like, I don't know.  Why people -

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: there should just be some sort of rule that people don't die until they're older, 'cause then, at least, it's expected.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I agree.  If I knew how to make that happen, I would certainly help you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know what to do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: When's the service? Can- can we help?  Is there anything, I mean--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, you- you can go.  I don't know.  I don't know what else.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I hope it rains.  Somehow that'll make me feel more comfortable.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Seems like if the whole world's sad, then it's okay for you to be.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just wish there was some way to just bring him back to life magically.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just, you know, some thing; some genie. I need to find a genie bottle.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't have any magic answers.  But,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I mean, as- as cliche as it is, as long as people who loved him remember him, then it's not a waste, you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, hi.  Um, look, I -- all I'm trying to do right now is renew my license plate.  That's all.  I just need to get one of those little stickers.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.  What's the problem?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I've- I've- some lady -- I got in line.  I waited for about two hours um, and, I gave her this form

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: that she gave to me earlier. And she said oh, I gave you the wrong one by accident.  So I was hoping I could just fill out a new one, give it to you and sort of skip this whole line business.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay, um.  Do you have your photo ID with you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes, I do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.  This is the wrong form.  I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is -- okay, then just can I have the form that I need.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't have the form.  You're going to have to go get in that line over there and they will give you the right form.  And after you fill it out, you can bring it back to me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Don't you -- you don't have-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: are you telling me you don't have a stack of them behind the desk?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't have any of

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I don't have any of them over here.  You're gonna have to go get in that line over there.  And they will give you a copy of the form.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But you're -- it's the same -- I mean, you can -- like I can't go behind your desk--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Nope, I don't. I don't have-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: or I can't go behind there- you can go behind this person's desk and just grab the form. So if you could just do that; that would help me out a lot.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, I can't. That's-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.  You have to do things the way you have to do things here.  We have rules.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look, can you please just-- --make this -- look, I look--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Go get in that-- Sir-- Sir, there are people in line behind you. you need

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: look-- It's  been- it's been two hours.  Can you please just make this easier on me and just go and get the form?  It's not- it's really not

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry you're having a hard time,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: but you're gonna have to go get in  that line to

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What if I pay you money?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Can I pay you money?  Can I give you, like, twenty bucks and you'll go back there and get the form?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: twenty bucks? Please. Go get in that line over there.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Come on.  Will you please?  I just --I look, I  cannot-- --just if I --

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Look, I'm having a really bad day.  I'm off in twenty minutes and I just really don't need this right now, okay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't care, well- You're having a bad -- I just waited in line for two hours.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And you're gonna have to go wait again, because that's the line you need.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well I just -- I can't do that right -- can you please just grab the form? All you have to do is grab the form.  I'm not gonna ask anything else of you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't do that. It's against our rules. You can go get in that line over there or you can just go ahead and leave and come back another day.  Maybe there will be a shorter line.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's all I- I just- That's all i want you to-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Rules, you just have to grab a piece of paper behind from somebody's desk

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not rocket science.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Come -- just, please, just grab the form.  It's right over there.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't do that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know it's right over there.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why are you being such a bitch?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but I can't do that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Please, will you please -- will you please just grab the form?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So go get in the other line or leave.  Or I will have you escorted out by security.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Would you like to be kicked out of the D.M.V.?  You don't think that'll be a little embarrassing?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Fine, which line is it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The one you just came from.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay, fine.  I'll go over there.  Thanks, a lot.  You've been really helpful.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.  Thank you.  Have a pleasant day.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What time is it?  They're supposed to run around midnight.  This is great isn't it?  Look at this night we've got here.  It couldn't be better.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Actually, I wanted to go a little farther up the coast, get away from the lights and the people, but I was afraid to miss it.  How you doing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Is that, is that-that's just foam isn't it?  I can't even tell

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: although if you can't tell, it probably isn't them.  It will probably be unmistakable.  Don't you think?  How you doing?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, no you know what I did?  I forgot my flashlight.  How could I be so stupid I forgot my flashlight.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What flashlight?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The flashlight, the silver one.  There's only one isn't there?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's not yours.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Whose is it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's ours.  It's mine too.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well sure.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You kept saying my flashlight as if it somehow is just yours.  How's that supposed to make me feel?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No of course our flashlight, yours and mine, mi flashlight es su flashlight naturally.  How could we not think to bring it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I hope the moon stays out.  I wonder do they always run during a full moon.  I can't remember if it was full last year.  Remember?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are you cold?  Do you want my jacket?  We should have brought the blanket, our blanket.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, this is great, isn't it?  I didn't even think to bring a six-pack.  A six-pack would be just the ticket right about now.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I can't believe I forgot.  I'm like a kid.  It's amazing I got out of the house with my fly zipped.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh, I wonder if they can hear me talk or feel the vibrations in the sand when we move around?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm cold.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do you want my jacket?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's after eleven let's go home.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Are you kidding?  We'd miss it.  We just got here.  What's the point of coming down here if we just turn around and go home?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: There is no point in coming down here.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's my point.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's my point too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: So let's go home.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, no, no.  That's not my point.  My point is is that there's no point in coming down here if we just leave.  Don't you want to see it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not particularly.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I just don't.  It's stupid.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Honey this is natural phenomenon.  I mean this only happens once a year.  This is a great opportunity.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Think about the people in Kansas.  They'd have to get plane tickets and hotel reservations to come see this.  We're just forty minutes away.  It's too good to pass up.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Pass up what?  These little fish swim onto the beach, flop around, and then swim away and then they die.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah but that moment on the beach is the highlight of their little lives.  All that flopping around is laying eggs or what do you, spawning or mating something like that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: This is the big night for these guys.  Life's last orgy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What are you so excited about?  This isn't a moon landing we're talking about.  It's fish.  It's fish nobody even eats.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, they do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, Augie.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay but it's fish who do something none of the other fish do

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: like the swallows returning to Capistrano or the lemmings throwing themselves off the cliffs, like that.  There's mystery here and magic

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: a little bit of the unexplainable.  I don't see how you cannot be interested.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm just not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: For real?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't get it.  The first time we came here to see it you said it was the best night of your life and last year I remember distinctly you were so excited to get here.  You stubbed your toe rushing me out the door and didn't even notice until we were in the car.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Last year you will also remember our shoes got wet.  I got sand in my panties.  We got in a big fight over nothing.  You got a sore throat and we did not see the Grunions.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We weren't in a good spot.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We didn't see them the first time either.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We just weren't in a good spot.  This is a much better spot.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I've got good instincts for these things.  Look there. What's that.  Is that?  Is that, is that-no it's just seaweed isn't it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, man this is great.  I wouldn't miss this for anything.  I mean think about this.  I know you're not interested but just think about this for a minute.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Out there someplace there's this huge mass of silver fish heading this way.  They don't know why.  We don't know why.  It wasn't a decision.  They didn't take a vote.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No one sent them a map or an invitation.  Just some little instinctual time release firecracker went off in their little bodies and all as one. They turned and formed a line as long as the California coast and started swimming.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They're swimming right now as if that's the only thing that matters.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's single mindedness with no mind.  Urgency that's pure urge.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: They don't know what drives them.  They don't give it a name or ask question.  They just turn as one and start the swim that brings them here to this place

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: where we stand for massive celebration of sex and death.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah, I'm giving myself goose bumps.  All my hairs are popping up.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's the wind.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well so what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What I said.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's ridiculous.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What time is it?  They're supposed to run around midnight.  This is great, isn't it?  Look at this night we've got here; couldn't be better.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Actually, I wanted to go a little farther up the coast, get away from the lights and the people, but I was afraid we'd miss it.  How you doing?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Fine.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Is that, is that - is that just foam?  I can't even tell.  Although, if you can't tell, it's probably isn't them.  It'll probably be unmistakable, don't you think?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How you doing?  Oh, no, you know what I did?  I forgot to bring my flashlight.  How could I be so stupid?  I should have brought my flashlight.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What flashlight?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The flashlight; the silver one.  There's only one, isn't there?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's not yours.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Whose is it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's ours.  It's mine, too.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, sure.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, of course, our flashlight; yours and mine.  Me flashlight es su flashlight, naturally.  How could we not think to bring it?  I hope the moon stays out.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.speaker: M

All my hairs are popping up.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's the wind.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well so what did you think?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You're the only one I know who loves his parents.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know.  It's going out of style isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, it's good.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's so lovely here.  The air is sweet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So you're not sorry you came?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No.  But I'm not going to stay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well your mother has much as told me to leave.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, you saw that! And you.  You've been-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well sort of embarrassed soon as I came.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well the plan was to kind of sneak up on you over a period of a week or so.  But uh- they take it for granted that we're all set.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I figured they would- your mother at least.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: How did you know?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, from her point of view why else would I come?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, would you want to?  I guess you know this is why I asked you to come.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I guess this is why I came.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Anne, I love you.  I love you a great deal.  I love you!

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I- I -I have no imagination, that's all I know what to say, I-I'm embarrassing you. I I didn't want to tell you here.  I wanted it to be some place different, some place where we could be new to each other you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You feel it's wrong here, don't you- this yard, this chair?  I want you to be ready for me Annie.  I don't want to win you away from anything.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Chris, I've been ready for a long time.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Then, he's gone forever-you're sure?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I almost got married two years ago.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Why didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You started to write me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You felt something that far back?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Every day since.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Annie, why didn't you say something to me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well I was waiting for you!  I mean I didn't-until then you hadn't written and when you write- when you wrote what did you say?  I mean you sure can be ambiguous Chris.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Give me a kiss, Ann. Give me a-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh God- I kissed Annie! I can't believe I kissed Annie!  How long I've wanted to do this.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'll never forgive you.  Why did you wait so long?  All this time I've been wondering if I was a fool for thinking of you!

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh Annie, we're going to live now.  I'm going to make you so happy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Not like that, you're not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I kissed you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Like Larry's brother.  Do it like you, Chris.  Chris, what's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Let's Let's drive someplace.  I- I want to be alone with you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, what is it, your mother?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, nothing like that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What is it?  Even in your letters, there is something ashamed.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, I suppose I have been.  But it's going from me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know how to start.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It wouldn't work like this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's- It's mixed up with so many other things, I-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Remember when I was overseas?  I was in command of the company.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: yeah sure.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I lost them.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: how many?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: just about all.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh gee.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Takes a little time to toss something like that off you know because they weren't just men-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: for instance, there's this one time.  It had been raining for several days.  And this kid came up to me and gave me his last pair of dry socks. you know, He just put them in my pocket.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I know that- that's not a big thing, but it's just the kind of guys I had. They didn't die. They- They killed themselves for each other.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean that exactly that-a little more selfish and they would have still been here today.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I got an ideal, watching them all go down.  Everything was being destroyed see and-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: but it seemed to me that something new was being created at the same time, a kind of responsibility, man for man.  Do you understand me?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And to show that-to-to bring that back onto the earth again like a- like a monument.  And everyone would have it standing behind them and- and it would make a difference for them.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And then I went home and it was incredible.  It had no meaning here.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was all like some kind of bus accident to them.  I went back to work with my dad, in that whole rat race again.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I felt what you said- ashamed somehow-because nobody had changed at all.  It seemed to make suckers out of a whole lot of guys. and

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It felt wrong to be alive-to open that bank-book; to buy that new car; to look at that new refrigerator.  I mean, you can take those things out of the war, but if you drive that car, you have to know that that comes from the love that a man has for a man.  And you've got to be a little bit better than that!

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And if you're not, then it's all just loot and it's got blood on it, and I don't want any of it!  And, I guess that included you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you still feel like that?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I I want you now, Annie.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Because you can't feel like that anymore Chris, you hear me?  I mean everything that you have, you deserve.  And that includes me.  And your father?  Your father put hundreds of planes in the air, you should be proud.  A man should be paid for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh Annie.  Annie, I am going to make you a fortune!

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What would I do with a fortune?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Ryan, what's wrong?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just got some bad news.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: My friend, Shotty, passed away.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm so sorry

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The end, he's been sick for awhile.  He had cancer.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my gosh.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.  It's just, I never thought it would actually happen, you know? I mean- He's such a fighter and he's always so positive about everything.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know, he was gonna, and we -- all the way up to the end we were just talking about how- you know all the stuff we were gonna do and, you know.  When he finally kicked this stupid cancer, you know, and we were gonna --

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: he wanted to travel, you know.  And he's so talented.  Probably the most talented person I have ever met in my entire life.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What did he do?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: He was a designer, you know.  But he did everything. You know, He painted and he- and he did costume design, he did set design, he did lighting, he was --

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: he just did everything.  He was literally, literally the most talented guy I have ever met in my entire life.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And he's gone now and I  -- I just can't believe it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.  I'm so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I mean, one second you think, you know, you're just having a conversation and then --

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: you know, sometimes you think you want to make that phone call, or you think you want to tell somebody something, or something like that.  Do you know what I mean?  Like that's -- he was the person that I did that with.  You know, like, that's the person who I needed to call to tell things to all the time.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You guys have been-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And now I don't have that person anymore, you know.  And it's -- -- it's just, you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You think that things get easier, you know, as you as you get older and you -

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: and it just gets worse.  It just gets worse, everything is bad all the time; people die, your friends die, family dies, your best friends die. it's-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. I-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You always think, you know when you were- you know when you were a little kid and you think something is gonna happen, like, it will all be better when I am older, you know?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And I don't know why people don't just tell you off the bat that it's just gonna suck anyway.  You know, like, what's the point?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All the best people die, all the bad people live and they make life shitty for you anyway.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Wow, Ryan I know that you are hurting right now but I don't think you always feel like that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, you're right.  I don't.  You're right.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Even, yeah -- he doesn't he would never feel that way, he would never want me to feel that way.  Of course not, but that's just where I am right now and -- -- I don't know what else to do with it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah. I understand.  I think it's really healthy to grieve.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just miss him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: If there's anything I can do to be there for you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You knew there was nothing in that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You accepted presents from him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Only a trivial little broach.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I remember it well, covered in diamonds in the worst possible taste.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, not at all.  I-I still have it.  I wear it quite often.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You must admit that he was in love with you, wasn't he?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: maybe just a little, but--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You let him kiss you.  You said you did.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And what of it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What of it?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, I- he got a lot of pleasure out of it and it didn't hurt me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What about me?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well, if you hadn't been so nosey and suspicious, you never would have heard about it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, that's a nice point of view I must say.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm growing quite tired and bored of this conversation.

And so, all right, and I'm putting on my coat, I'm putting out the animals, I'm pulling the car out of the garage.

It's like L.A. is so frustrating because if you don't know somebody, you can't -you can't get a job.  It's impossible.  It's totally discriminatory.  You have to know somebody.

dialogue.text: Oh. Venice beach.

dialogue.text: Okay. That would be way too much of a commute you can't do that. Especially- I know especially from--I don't know, what I was going to say, I don't know.

dialogue.text: Professional softball player Malibu. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.text: From where? Huh? Well I'm from San Francisco.

dialogue.text: I don't know. Commuting from what Malibu that would be ridiculous.

dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that would be.  Well, depends on what type of car you had, though too. I guess it would be worth it. helicopter. Yeah, helicopter.  There is a helipad there, right? Yeah, exactly.

dialogue.text: Oh yeah. He'd drop you right off at practice?

dialogue.text: Yeah, but no. Well, they have a night games but you know there's more like night games they're not like morning games, you know. I guess it's kind of same thing.

dialogue.text: I'm surprised you don't know that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh. That is incredible. Is it--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: do they have a--is it a co-ed softball team?  I mean... Really? You know, I didn't even know that they have that.

dialogue.speaker: M

dialogue.text: They do it's--believe me it's huge.

dialogue.text: Who do you play? Like do--are you like... nationally ranked?

dialogue.text: I just got into it. I just kind of fell into it. Literally I was walking around and...

dialogue.text: That is unbelievable.

dialogue.text: It's pretty wild.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I would put that right up there with--ping-pong.

dialogue.text: Yeah, well I doubt [GARBAGE] ping pong [GARBAGE]

dialogue.text: I mean not to denigrate what you are doing.  I think that's great.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Oh you mean it's not really sport that what you're saying?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, no.  I love softball. I played softball all the time.

dialogue.text: It's totally a sport. What are you talking about?

dialogue.text: What, just 'cause I don't play regular baseball doesn't mean I'm like any less of like a sports guy.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I am not saying you should be. I'm not no. I think it's great I think you should be incredibly proud yourself especially because you're going to U.S.C for free for doing it. For free.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: For free that's really what it's about. I mean who cares I mean if I have to play softball all the time?

dialogue.text: But they got to like drive around in a bus--that would suck.

dialogue.text: Oh really? With the whole team?

dialogue.text: Oh really?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Cool. You don't seem like you'd fit in there.

dialogue.text: That kind of...They're okay.  No I'm like- I'm kind of like the odd man out I'm like...

dialogue.text: Oh, cool.

dialogue.text: But you know I'm like [GARBAGE].

dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Pull over..

dialogue.text: How could he see it?  I was the first one up; he was still in bed.

dialogue.text: He was out here when it broke.

dialogue.text: When?

dialogue.text: What was he doing out here at four o clock in the morning?

dialogue.text: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: He's dreaming of him again, walking around.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I guess he is.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's getting to be just like after he died.  What's the meaning of that?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't know the meaning of it.  But I know one thing, Mom, you've made a terrible mistake with father.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Being dishonest with him, you know.  This kind of thing always pays off and it's paying off.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What do you mean dishonest?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know Larry is not coming back and I know it.  Why do we allow him to go on thinking that we believe with him?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What do you want to do?  Argue with him?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't want to argue but it's time he realized that nobody believes Larry is alive.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know?  Why shouldn't he walk the nights thinking of him, dreaming of him?   Do we contradict him?  Do we say, we don't have any hope anymore?  That we haven't had any hope for years now?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You can't say that to him.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We've got to say it to him.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Where's the proof?  Do you have any proof?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: For God's sake, three years?  Nobody comes back after three years; that's insane.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: To you it is, to me it is, but to your father, you can talk yourself until you are blue in the face.  But there is no grave and there is no body, so where are you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Sit down, Mom.  I want to talk to you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's that the trouble is those God damn newspapers.  Every month some new boy comes back and so the next one is going to be Larry, they just--

dialogue.text: All right, all right, all right.  You know why I asked Annie here, right?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know.

dialogue.text: Well I got an idea, but what's your story?

dialogue.text: I'm going to ask her to marry me.
